thread.title: Video: I shall suffer the penalty, if I break my oath of office- Ghana’s President
thread.title_full: Video: I shall suffer the penalty, if I break my oath of office- Ghana’s President

author: Ikenna
title: Video: I shall suffer the penalty, if I break my oath of office- Ghana’s President
text:
Breaking News Translate Home » News » Video: I shall suffer the penalty, if I break my oath of office- Ghana’s President Video: I shall suffer the penalty, if I break my oath of office- Ghana’s President On 3:17 pm In News by Ikenna Comments 
Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo was yesterday, sworn in as Ghana’s new president after having won a majority of votes in the December elections. 
Akufo-Addo of the opposition New Patriotic Party (NPP) is the fifth president to be elected under the country’s 1992 constitution. Akufo-Addo’s NPP also won an overwhelming majority of seats in Ghana’s parliament. 
In a trending video on social media, Akufo-Addo, in his oath of office, affirmed to suffer the full penalty of the laws of Ghana, if he breaks the oath of office. 
See video below: 
— Didi Akinyelure (@DidiAkin) January 7, 2017 Ikenna
